result.execSummary:
The defendant Alfred Curtis Gallion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. Release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center no other release privileges; with credit for 3 days (4-28-2014, 04-29-2014 and 04-30-2014) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
Fine is set at ZERO.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program during probation or until completed.
Maintain fulltime employment.
Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
No contact with Leo Gallion (DOB 08-13-1981).

Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first year of probation.
Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/ 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used.
Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
Defendant must attend at least 1 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per month.

timeConds.notes:
Court ordered defendant to serve 132 DAYS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. This is stayed to use as follows: 
First violation of positive drug/alcohol test OR possession/use of controlled substances without a valid prescription OR possession of drug paraphernalia to serve 7 DAYS, with release for work or inmate work assignments. 
Second violation of positive drug/alcohol test OR possession/use of controlled substances without a valid prescription OR possession of drug paraphernalia to serve 125 DAYS, with release for Day Reporting Center, work or inmate work assignments.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alfred Curtis Gallion

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alfred Curtis Gallion in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Paul Hauer on behalf of Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1-
Court ordered defendant to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center no other release privileges; with credit for 3 days (4-28-2014, 04-29-2014 and 04-30-2014) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Defendant must attend at least 1 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per month. 
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first year of probation.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/ 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program during probation or until completed. 
- Maintain fulltime employment. 
- No contact with Leo Gallion (DOB 08-13-1981).
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 132 DAYS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. This is stayed to use as follows: 
* First violation of positive drug/alcohol test OR possession/use of controlled substances without a valid prescription OR possession of drug paraphernalia to serve 7 DAYS, with release for work or inmate work assignments. 
*Second violation of positive drug/alcohol test OR possession/use of controlled substances without a valid prescription OR possession of drug paraphernalia to serve 125 DAYS, with release for Day Reporting Center, work or inmate work assignments.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Court orders defendant RELEASED to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alfred Curtis Gallion in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing, however Branch 17 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Alfred Curtis Gallion in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Case proceeded to plea hearing.
 AS TO COUNT 1:
 Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court vacated jury trial scheduled for 06-03-2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alfred Curtis Gallion in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Alfred Curtis Gallion in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing May 9, 2014 at 8:30 am in Branch PE
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
